headline: Thur. 10:15 a.m.: Legislators join forces to increase airport funding
sentences:
U.S. Reps. Tim Ryan, D-Howland, and Bill Johnson, R-Marietta, introduced legislation that would designate any airport in use by an air reserve station as a “primary airport.”
The change in the United States Code would allow the Youngstown-Warren Regional Airport and Youngstown Air Reserve Station to be once again designated as a primary airport.

Because of this, Youngstown-Warren faces significant and increasing challenges to maintain its infrastructure for current users, including the 910th Airlift Wing, corporate, charter, and general aviation users.
VIENNA — A legislative move is afoot to change U.S. law and bring more maintenance funding to the Youngstown-Warren Regional Airport and Youngstown Air Reserve Station.
Currently, Youngstown-Warren is the only commercial airport in the country with an Air Reserve Station that does not have commercial air service.
Upon the loss of commercial air service in 2018, the FAA significantly reduced the annual maintenance funding at the airfield.
Read MORE in Friday’s TRIBUNE CHRONICLE.
